alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Coastal; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 5:06AM EST until December 24 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. * WHERE...Coastal portions of southwest Alabama and northwest Florida. * WHEN...From 6 AM Friday to 10 AM CST Saturday. Lowest wind chills will occur Friday morning and again Friday night. * IMPACTS...Extremely low wind chill temperatures can increase the likelihood of adverse cold weather effects on the body such as frostbite and hypothermia.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. Remain indoors in a warm area if possible, with only short times outdoors. If you must go outside, several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. A hat is also important as half your body heat loss can be from the head.
